## comparing() function

Creates a `Comparator` that compares objects of type `T` by mapping them to values of type `U` using a provided mapping function and then comparing the mapped values using a given comparison function.

**Signature:**

```typescript
comparing: <T, U>(mapper: (object: T) => U, compareFn: CompareFn<U>) =>
  Comparator<T>;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter

</th><th>

Type

</th><th>

Description

</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

mapper

</td><td>

(object: T) =&gt; U

</td><td>

A function that maps an object of type `T` to a value of type `U`<!-- -->.

</td></tr>
<tr><td>

compareFn

</td><td>

[CompareFn](./comparator.ts.comparefn.md)<!-- -->&lt;U&gt;

</td><td>

A function that compares two mapped values of type `U`<!-- -->. Should return a negative number if the first value is less than the second, zero if they are equal, or a positive number if the first is greater.

</td></tr>
</tbody></table>
**Returns:**

[Comparator](./comparator.ts.comparator.md)<!-- -->&lt;T&gt;

A `Comparator` for comparing objects of type `T` based on their mapped values.
